DataElement.preferredName: Positive Finding Diagnostic Procedure Use Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the positive finding diagnostic tests used.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism._Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.

Concepts.definition: Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fluid introduced into, and collected from, the lungs by a bronchoalveolar lavage procedure.

Concepts.definition: Fluid introduced into, and collected from, the lungs by a bronchoalveolar lavage procedure.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasal Swab And/Or Nasal Wash and Collection

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasal Swab And/Or Nasal Wash and Collection
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method used to collect biological material from within the nasal passages. A cotton swab is inserted into the nasal opening and rotated against the anterior nasal mucosa and them withdrawn.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.: A method used to collect biological material from within the nasal passages. A saline solution is introduced into the nasal passages, retained briefly, and then expelled.

Concepts.definition: A method used to collect biological material from within the nasal passages. A cotton swab is inserted into the nasal opening and rotated against the anterior nasal mucosa and then withdrawn.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A method used to collect biological material from within the nasal passages. A saline solution is introduced into the nasal passages, retained briefly, and then expelled.

PermissibleValues.value: Histopathology findings of viral cytopathic changes

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with a virus.: A branch of pathology that studies and diagnoses diseases on the cellular level including the anatomy, physiology, pathology and chemistry of the cell.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.: The outcome of a microscopic pathologic examination using various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with a virus.
A branch of pathology that studies and diagnoses diseases on the cellular level including the anatomy, physiology, pathology and chemistry of the cell.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
The outcome of a microscopic pathologic examination using various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
